settings.text:
From our THE BARN Roastery in Berlin, we are sending fresh Specialty Coffee Beans to our international café partners and webshop subscribers across the world.

You will be daily processing our incoming b2c and b2b-orders, organise export-documents and book the transportation tickets. Working hands-on in dispatch and on the packing floor is your daily routine. A vivid exchange with our sales and webshop team, the roast team and the logistics companies make this position super interesting. English and German are a pre-requisite, especially when handling the export documents and the parties involved.

We are looking for a self-organised team player to fit our fantastic, international team which is integrated in our Roastery in Berlin-Wedding. You are solution oriented, and you work towards set deadlines. Ideally you bring in experience working with freight forwarders and shipping.

This is a part-time job, ideal for someone who is looking to work 30 hours in the mornings on weekdays only. Please note that we need a minimum commitment of one year, ideally longer.

settings.heading:
THE JOB


- First point of contact for everything to do with logistics and monitor our dispatch workflows
- Packing of beans, fulfilling orders in dispatch, and making sure all is organised and on-time
- Processing incoming B2B and B2C orders & prep labels and required documentation
- Track moving items and interact with shipping companies (DHL, UPS, Fedex etc)
- Weekly inventory of equipment and packaging materials
- Ensuring the workplace is organised and clean
- Reports to the management

settings.text:
YOUR SKILLSET

This position is easy to run if you are good at office administration, keep track and be organized with procedures and holding deadlines.

- The ability to work accurate and fast is required.
- You bring previous experience in logistics floor work.
- Fast learner, responsive and good communicator.
- German & English is the best combination for us.

Fast learner, responsive and good communicator. German & English is the best combination for us

WHAT TO EXPECT FROM US

- Great working environment with an international staff base
- Amazing coffee for free all day
- Fair payment, holidays, and social / health insurance

Our product is based on a concept of full quality and sustainability improvements. We work closely with our coffee farmers to get the best out of them. In return, we pay them fairly and treat them with respect..

LOCATION

Wattstraße 10-13, Berlin-Humboldthain (5 minutes by bicycle from Rosenthaler Platz)

CONTRACT

- Part-time. 30 hours per week. 5 weekdays, starting at 7:30am
- Term: 1 year with option to extend
- Hourly Pay: minimum 15 EUR / depending on qualification

IMPORTANT NOTES

- You do need an EU passport and working permit for Germany.
- Interview (Vorstellungsgespräch): We do not cover or refund any expenses related to visiting us for a personal interview (expenses for travel, accommodation, or food)
